mods.abstract: In the early years of the 20th century, CBC granted Masters degrees to graduates who had distinguished themselves professionally. In 1904, the Masters recipients were (L-R): T. Roane Waring, Patrick Henry Phelan, A. Monroe Wynne, Frank L. Monteverde , William W. Saxby, Augustine A. Chighizola. A seventh recipient, David Frayser, was not pictured with the group. Waring delivered the Masters oration on the subject of "The Church and Education."

For all requests, please contact the Archives at archives@cbu.edu.
